questions.question: He is ……………………….. runner of them all.
questions.description: The superlative is used to compare a person or thing with the whole group he/she/it belongs to.

questions.question: Susie and Janet are both pretty girls, but I think Susie is …………………………….. of the two.
questions.description: When a group has just two members, the comparative is used instead of the superlative.

questions.question: Can you talk ……………………………..?
questions.description: Comparative and superlative adverbs are usually made with more and most.

questions.question: Can you come ………………………………?
questions.description: Adverbs that have the same form as adjectives form their comparatives and superlatives with –er and –est.

questions.question: That was ……………………………. kind of you.
questions.description: When most means very, it is used without the.

questions.question: She is ……………………………… her father than her mother.
questions.description: The word like forms its comparatives and superlatives with more and most.

questions.question: She looks just ………………………….. her mother.
questions.description: We use like before a noun and as before a clause.

questions.question: I get up at 30 …………………………. my mother does.
questions.description: We use like before a noun and as before a clause.

questions.question: He looks …………………………….. younger than her.
questions.description: We cannot use very to modify comparative adjectives.

questions.question: She is ………………………….. woman I have ever known.
questions.description: Superlatives are more common with words like ever.

questions.question: Mandarin is …………………………….. more difficult than Hindi.
questions.description: Very cannot be used with comparatives.
